intro: Nenax hirta subsp. caliciphila, commonly known as the California hirta, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of California. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant prefers well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it faces threats to its survival.
